name: Inn at Langley

reviews.text: We just spent a weekend at the Inn at Langley to celebrate my husband's birthday. We stayed in one of the Cottages #57, a two-story one bedroom free-standing cottage with amazing views of the Puget Sound. The weekend was one of our favorite getaways ever! You cannot miss the six course dinner with wine pairing! Fabulous chef, outstanding staff and beautiful views. The only thing we didn't get to try was the Spa. We will go back again!
reviews.title: One of the most wonderful weekends ever; beautiful setting, amazing room and views, and most delicious 6 course dinner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can you say about a place that is nearly perfect? The Inn at Langley caters to your every whim.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a corner room on the 4th floor. The bathroom was amazing - large stone-floored shower and a jacuzzi tub - overlooking the water. All the rooms have balconies facing the water and come equipped with the usual coffee and tea amenities as we well as a complimentary snack basket as well.
reviews.title: Incredible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furnishings are elegant but not fussy. More importantly, there was adequate reading lights and comfortable seats -although we spent most of our time on the balcony.
reviews.title: Still a favorite...

reviews.text: Breakfast is amazing (Yes, a complimentary copy of the New York Times! And, on Sunday too!). A bountiful array of local fruits and terrific baked goods - both savory and sweet. You'll want to get the recipes, which I did, so you can make them at home. Scones, granola, an egg dish, and breakfast "cookies."
reviews.title: Absolutely Magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here one night in late November. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The view from the clean room overlooking the water was exceptional. The complementary breakfast was fresh and satisfying. Although I only spent one evening at the Inn at Langley I really enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Nice people and pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife took me out to this highly rated, touted Inn for my Birthday meal. The Prix Fixe menu was discouraging with all the dishes tasting like they had all been prepared well in advance, earlier in the day, nothing tasted fresh or freshly prepared, we were sitting at the Chefs table, and decided to have the wine pairings. None of the wine pairings were exceptional and were quite dissapointing. We paid in excess of $500.00 for the meal for 2 including 19% gratuity. Slap in the face, I called twice to retrieve my jacket I had mistakenly left, first time on message machine, no return call, 2nd time spoke to a person Brenda?, that said she would call me back, no call back. I had to drive there to get a response that they had seen the jacket on the coat rack but it dissapeared, One of the staff wearing it? Another $400 of jacket gone for a grand total of $900.00 + on a very crappy meal and misplaced goods. Go to Cafe Langley instead!!
reviews.title: Terrible Dinner with wine for 2!! Extreme dissapointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely experience. Our room was clean and relaxing, and the view was amazing. The receptionist may have been the most friendly person I have ever met. We stayed on a Friday night, ate dinner in town and had breakfast at the inn. Overall, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As before we had a completely enjoyable and relaxing weekend at the Inn at Langley. The room was minimally but tastefully decorated and was so quiet - the only noise was the waves lapping at the shore. We had dinner on Saturday evening and it was just amazing - how Matt Costello keeps coming up with such varied and incredible dishes is beyond me. But I must also call out the breakfast buffer - everything is freshly made and again tastes delicous. We'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: Another great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at the inn last week- went on a Sunday/Monday so we could do the dinner on Sunday night- also recommend the spa connected to the inn- the room was great, loved the fireplace and the view from the deck was beautiful (we lucked into great weather). if you go, don't miss the dinner- it was truly memorable. If there was anything I would have liked would have been a bit more selection at breakfast- really it is a continental breakfast- but I suppose we could have just walked into town. the owners cmae and chatted briefly with us and checked to make sure we didn't need anything and that we were having a nice time. All in all, a very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Inn at Langley, the town and the drives around Whidbey Island. The hotel rooms are spacious and the view is wonderful. Having said that it seemed pricey for the location and time of year.
reviews.title: Beautiful location - but pricey choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at the Inn at Langley and after a hard week at work, it was a perfect retreat! Located right on the water with views of Eagles and Herron, we were able to relax and rejuvenate. We stayed in the Cottage which was equipped with a tea kettle (yippee for a tea drinker) tasteful furnishings, crisp sheets and a view from even the bathtub! The bathroom has a lovely walk in shower and Jacuzzi tub .The living room is spacious with fireplace and flat sceen , the large bedroom is also equipped with a fireplace and flat screen tv and windows that open to the Saratoga Passage (perfect for hearing gulls and I understand watching during the season ) The Inn at Langley is quiet, peaceful, walking distance to the lovely seaside town of Langley and just a hop from Seattle so we can hardly wait to return !
reviews.title: Wonderful, peaceful stay

reviews.text: Asian simplicity. All rooms with great water views. Best jacuzzi yet. In walkable Langley. Poor cable reception. 4 stars!
reviews.title: An Asian understatement....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Waiting many years to come here, so glad we finally went! Everything was great. The view from our room was great, the view from the oversized tub was even better! The fireplace is such a treat. We brought a tea kettle to make tea, but found the room comes with one, what a nice surprise for tea drinkers! The fridge was handy for keeping some wine we brought cool. The dinner was amazing and we loved it. We bought the wine pairing to go with, but be careful because you will get a lot of wine! (at least for us) Glad we only had to walk to our room because we wouldn't have been able to drive. The breakfast is great!! Quiche, homemade scones, muffins, granola, smoked salmon, triple brie, crackers, toast, fruit. We skipped lunch after eating so much at breakfast. Best part is the trays and thermos they give you if you want to take it back to your room to eat. Langley is a cute little town to explore, but we spent most of our time at the Inn just relaxing. They have DVDs available in the office for use in your room, but we neer turned on the tv, the peace and quiet was just what we needed. When I made the reservation, they asked if there was a special occasion and I mentioned our anniversary. Everyone wished us a happy anniversary and they left a card and bottle of wine in our room. Very caring service. I really cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: We just returned from another fantastic trip at the Inn at Langley and it did not disappoint. This was our second trip here and it was again great. Everyone we ran into who works there is extremely helpful and friendly. The room was perfect with a big jetted tub and a fireplace and you cannot beat the view right off your balcony of boats going by. The location can't be beat since you are right in the cute town of Langley and a short stroll to all of the shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Relaxing place to get away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would rate our experience at the Inn at Langley on par with what you would expect from an average hotel, or even motel - but for a premium price. We shared our concerns (similar to what I've shared below) with the Inn staff and I do believe they were genuinely upset that we had such a sub-par experience. Unfortunately there wasn't much done at the time of our stay to correct the situation 'in the moment' but I am very appreciative of their efforts and follow-up after the fact, which is why in sum I am rating the Inn as "Average" rather than what it would have been otherwise, which would have been "Poor". I do hope that the feedback we shared will go toward improved experience for future guests, and it is my strong belief that Matt (GM) and his staff take it all very seriously. So definitely speak up if you choose to stay at the Inn - if there is anything they can do to improve your experience, I am quite sure they will.
reviews.title: Our experience wasn't very good; yours could be - share any concerns with the staff!

reviews.text: I read a number of reviews before deciding on Langley for a weekend getaway for my birthday with my husband. We have a young infant and 2 toddlers at home, and we were looking for a relaxing place to get some much-needed sleep and to enjoy a little bit of luxury. I spoke with Karly at the Inn at Langley and she was terrific. She spent a good deal of time talking to me about the town and the inn and I was convinced this is where we should go. I had read unfavorable reviews about the rooms and so requested a renovated room. My preference was to be on the top floor, but there were none availabe. As a nice gesture, we were upgraded to a corner room, but it was on the lower level.
reviews.title: The setting, genuine and caring service, and truly extraordinary dining should not be missed!

reviews.text: Unfortunately, that is where the positive experience ended for us.
reviews.title: Have had more comfortable stays at Best Western
Really great place in a really nice little village
reviews.text: The lower level felt very much like a 'basement' and was pretty dark and gloomy. The corner room was right against a hillside and got very little light. We were in a renovated room, and it was certainly fine, but definitely didn't have the type of finishes that I would rave about. The shower had been updated with a nice stone, but I was surprised for such a big space to only have one shower head. And although I knew there were only queen-sized beds avaible, it still strikes me as odd not to have Kings, especially when the room was plenty big for it. We were also surprised that there was no comfortable 'lounge space' in the room. Only a couple of upright chairs. At least in the room we were in (10) there was plenty of space for a sitting area - kind of odd to have a big corner suite but nowhere to actually hang out? The placement of the TV was a little awkward tucked in the corner - not sure why it wasn't above the fireplace where it would be a much better viewing experience. And we were a little bummed not to have in-room movie selection (there are videos available at the front desk, but the selection is not very good).

The biggest disappointment by far, however, was how little sound-proofing there was between the floors. We could hear every move made by the guests above us - nothing 'inappropriate' - just regular living, but it was akin to a cheap apartment building, not a premium-priced inn. So the much-needed sleep was not possible unfortunately.
reviews.title: A lovely spot with wonderful helpful reception and housekeeping staff and we've stayed here for years.

description: Located in Langley built into a bluff overlooking the Cascade Mountains.
